TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NegotiateAuthentication extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class NegotiateAuthentication Implements IDisposable
public ref class NegotiateAuthentication sealed : IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a stateful authentication exchange that uses the Negotiate, NTLM, or Kerberos security protocols to authenticate the client or server, in client-server communication.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationClientOptions clientOptions) cil managed

Docs.param: The property bag for the authentication options.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the for client-side authentication session.

Docs.param: The property bag for the authentication options.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the for server-side authentication session.

abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[]? GetOutgoingBlob (ReadOnlySpan<byte> incomingBlob, out System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode statusCode);

.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GetOutgoingBlob(valuetype System.ReadOnlySpan`1<unsigned int8> incomingBlob, [out] valuetype System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode& statusCode) cil managed
Public Function GetOutgoingBlob (incomingBlob As ReadOnlySpan(Of Byte), ByRef statusCode As NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode) As Byte()

Docs.param: Incoming authentication token, or empty value when initiating the authentication exchange.
Status code returned by the authentication provider.
Docs.summary: Evaluates an authentication token sent by the other party and returns a token in response.
Docs.returns: An outgoing authentication token to be sent to the other party.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When initiating the authentication exchange, one of the parties starts with an empty incomingBlob parameter.
Successful authentication returns either the <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.Completed> or <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.ContinueNeeded> status code. Any other status code indicates an unrecoverable error.
When <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.ContinueNeeded> is returned, the return value is an authentication token to be transported to the other party.

MemberSignature.Value: public string? GetOutgoingBlob (string? incomingBlob, out System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode statusCode);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetOutgoingBlob(string incomingBlob, [out] valuetype System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode& statusCode) cil managed
Public Function GetOutgoingBlob (incomingBlob As String, ByRef statusCode As NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode) As String

Docs.param: Incoming authentication token, or empty value when initiating the authentication exchange. Encoded as base64.
Status code returned by the authentication provider.
Docs.summary: Evaluates an authentication token sent by the other party and returns a token in response.
Docs.returns: An outgoing authentication token to be sent to the other party, encoded as base64.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When initiating the authentication exchange, one of the parties starts with an empty incomingBlob parameter.
Successful authentication returns either the <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.Completed> or <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.ContinueNeeded> status code. Any other status code indicates an unrecoverable error.
When <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationStatusCode.ContinueNeeded> is returned, the return value is an authentication token to be transported to the other party.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsAuthenticated As Boolean
public: property bool IsAuthenticated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether authentication was successfully completed and the session was established.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsEncrypted As Boolean
public: property bool IsEncrypted { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether data encryption was negotiated.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsMutuallyAuthenticated As Boolean
public: property bool IsMutuallyAuthenticated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether both server and client have been authenticated.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsServer As Boolean
public: property bool IsServer { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the local side of the authentication is representing the server.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSigned As Boolean
public: property bool IsSigned { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether data signing was negotiated.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Package As String
public: property System::String ^ Package { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the negotiated authentication package.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The negotiated authentication package is only available when the session authentication was finished (see <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthentication.IsAuthenticated>). For unfinished authentication sessions, the value is undefined and usually returns the initial authentication package name specified in <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationClientOptions.Package> or <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationServerOptions.Package>.
If the Negotiate package was used for authentication, the value of this property will be Kerberos, NTLM, or any other specific protocol that was negotiated between both sides of the authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ProtectionLevel As ProtectionLevel
public: property System::Net::Security::ProtectionLevel ProtectionLevel { System::Net::Security::ProtectionLevel get(); };

Docs.summary: Indicates the negotiated level of protection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The negotiated level of protection is only available when the session authentication was finished (see <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthentication.IsAuthenticated>). The protection level can be higher than the initially requested protection level specified by <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationClientOptions.RequiredProtectionLevel> or <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationServerOptions.RequiredProtectionLevel>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RemoteIdentity As IIdentity
public: property System::Security::Principal::IIdentity ^ RemoteIdentity { System::Security::Principal::IIdentity ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets information about the identity of the remote party.
Docs.value: An object that describes the identity of the remote endpoint.
Docs.exception: Authentication failed or has not occurred.
System error occurred when trying to retrieve the identity.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TargetName As String
public: property System::String ^ TargetName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the target name (service principal name) of the server.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For the server side of the authentication, the property returns the target name specified by the client after successful authentication (see <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthentication.IsAuthenticated>).
For the client side of the authentication, the property returns the target name specified in <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateAuthenticationClientOptions.TargetName>.
